title: Gareth Bale's agent responds to fresh speculation over China transfer
text:

Gareth Bale's agent has insisted that the Welshman is happy at Real Madrid - despite the pair holding talks in London this week.

The Wales forward will not feature in the La Liga match against bottom club Leganes on Wednesday night after he was given permission to travel to England to deal with a personal matter.

It is understood that Bale met up with representative Jonathan Barnett on Tuesday, which has led to suggestions in Spain that Bale may once again attempt to push for a move to China.

The former Tottenham superstar saw a big-money summer move to the Far East collapse at the last minute, after Madrid president Florentino Perez decided Bale's short-term future was best served in Spain.

(Image: Juan Carlos Hidalgo/EPA-EFE/REX)

And Barnett has refuted claims that Bale wants to leave, saying: "Gareth is delighted to play in Madrid.

“China? Don’t believe everything you hear.”

Having seen that summer move fail to materialise, Bale has made a handful of appearances for Los Blancos this season.

And manager Zinedine Zidane maintains there are no underlying issues with the 30-year-old, who has also struggled with fitness issues since returning from international duty.

"He went to London on a personal matter and with the permission of the club. He talked to the club because he has a right to personal things," the Real Madrid coach said.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

"You have to ask the club for permission, which is the most important thing. He also went because he's not available.

"It's a very simple matter. He asked the club for permission and the club gave it to him.

"We think that Bale is a player who puts in a lot of effort and trains well. He's important for this squad and for the club.

"When he's not available, he's not available because he's got something and that's it.

"There's a lot of talk and a lot of things said. When he's ready and 100 per cent, we'll see. He's focused on playing well for the team."
